message.content: This question requires a basic understanding of water treatment processes. Boiling water at a water treatment plant is done to eliminate harmful substances and microorganisms that may be present in the water. Boiling water kills bacteria, viruses, and parasites, making it safe for consumption. Option (A) is incorrect because adding oxygen is not the reason for boiling water at a water treatment plant. Option (B) is also incorrect because boiling water does not add specific health benefits, it simply makes it safe to drink. Option (D) is incorrect because mixing water is not the primary purpose of boiling it at a water treatment plant.

This question requires basic knowledge about water treatment processes. The reason why the water treatment plant boiled all the water that came to them is to eliminate substances. Boiling water helps to kill bacteria, viruses, and other pathogens that may be present in the water. It also helps to remove some impurities and chemicals that are not safe for consumption. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because boiling water does not serve these purposes. Adding oxygen, adding health benefits, or simply mixing the water can be done through other methods, not necessarily boiling.

This question requires some understanding of the purpose of water treatment plants. Water treatment plants boil water to eliminate substances and pathogens that may be harmful to human health. Boiling the water helps to kill bacteria, viruses, and other microorganisms that may be present in the water. Option (A) is incorrect because boiling water does not directly add oxygen to the water. Option (B) is incorrect because boiling water does not directly add any specific health benefits, although it does help to ensure the overall safety of the water. Option (D) is incorrect because mixing water is not the primary purpose of boiling in a water treatment plant.

This question requires knowledge about the purpose of boiling water in a water treatment plant. Boiling water helps to eliminate or kill harmful substances such as bacteria and viruses that may be present in the water. Option (A) is not the primary reason for boiling water in a treatment plant. Option (B) is also not the primary reason for boiling water. Option (D) is unrelated to the purpose of boiling water in a treatment plant.
